description.narrative: Under-five children and pregnant women have increased knowledge on optimal maternal, neonatal and child health and nutrition practices

sector.narrative: Community and home based maternal and newborn care
Diet diversity in early childhood (children under 5), includes complementary feeding and MNPs
IMNCI / Integrated Community Case Management (iCCM) - Community
Maternal nutrition, including information, supplementation and counselling
Technical assistance - Prevention of stunting and other forms of malnutrition

Burundi Programme Strategy Note Theory of Change (Health and Nutrition)

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Under-five children and pregnant women have increased knowledge on optimal maternal, neonatal and child health and nutrition practices

description.narrative: Some 1.2 million children were reached through community programmes, of whom at least 92% sought treatment within 24 hours for major diseases such as malaria, diarrhoea and pneumonia. The Light Mother programme reached about 66,000 children aged 6-59 months in three provinces (Ngozi, Rutana, Makamba), 2 million children screened for malnutrition and child health by (CHWs) and 27,000 pregnant women and newborns benefited from postnatal care programme in two provinces (Gitega, Cankuzo). | Status:On-track | As-of Date:09/01/2020

title.narrative: % of Districts implement ECD package for children at scale
Number of communication and advocacy campaigns in nutrition and health organized
Number of healthcare workers within health facilities and communities provided with Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) with UNICEF support [COVIDSitRep]
Percentage of ditricts providing care for children with SAM as part of regular health and nutrition services
Number of children aged 6 to 23 months receiving at least 90 sachets of MNPs two times per year with UNICEF support
Percentage of Health Districts in which the integrated multisectoral Nutrition, Wash, ECD and SPC package for the reduction of chronic malnutrition is implemented
Number of community health workers and "Mamans Lumire (Light Mothers)" trained with UNICEF support to provide IYCF counselling, including ECD
Percentage of districts implementing plans/programmes to improve the diversity of diets in children
Percentage of districts implementing the minimum package to prevent stunting in children
Number of community health workers that underwent skills enhancement programmes to operationalize integrated community case management (iCCM) through UNICEF-supported programmes
Availability of a national ECD policy or implementation plan for scale -up
